S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                         2240

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 14, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. RABBITT -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Corporations, Authorities and Commissions

       AN ACT to amend the public service law, in relation to  authorizing  the
         New  York  state  public  service  commission  to  approve  sewer rate
         increases

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Subdivisions 1 and 4 of section 89-c of the public service
    2  law, as added by chapter 715 of the laws of 1931, are amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    1. Shall have general supervision  of  all  water-works  corporations,
    5  INCLUDING SUCH CORPORATIONS PROVIDING SEWERAGE SERVICES, as hereinbefore
    6  defined,  having authority under any general or special law or under any
    7  charter or franchise to lay down, construct or maintain pipes, conduits,
    8  ducts or other fixtures in, on or under the streets, highways and public
    9  places of any municipality, for the purpose of furnishing or  distribut-
   10  ing  water  for  domestic,  commercial, SEWERAGE or public uses, and all
   11  water systems owned, leased or operated by any such  water-works  corpo-
   12  ration;  provided,  however,  that  nothing  herein  contained  shall be
   13  construed to delegate the general powers  of  the  state  department  of
   14  health or of the water power and control commission or any of the powers
   15  and  functions  of  either as provided by law, nor shall anything herein
   16  contained be construed to impair  nor  to  deprive  such  department  or
   17  commission of its powers and functions as now provided by law.
   18    4. Shall have power to examine all water-works corporations, INCLUDING
   19  SUCH  CORPORATIONS  PROVIDING SEWERAGE SERVICES, and keep informed as to
   20  the methods, practices, regulations and property employed by [them] SUCH
   21  CORPORATIONS in the transaction of their business. Whenever the  commis-
   22  sion shall be of the opinion, after a hearing had upon its own motion or
   23  upon  complaint,  that the rates, charges or classifications or the acts
   24  or regulations of any  such  corporation,  INCLUDING  SUCH  CORPORATIONS

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03685-01-1

       A. 2240                             2

    1  PROVIDING  SEWERAGE SERVICES, are unjust, unreasonable, unjustly discri-
    2  minatory, or unduly preferential, or in any wise  in  violation  of  any
    3  provision  of  law,  the commission shall determine and prescribe in the
    4  manner   provided   by   and   subject  to  the  provisions  of  section
    5  eighty-nine-j of this [chapter] ARTICLE, the just and reasonable  rates,
    6  charges and classifications thereafter to be enforced for the service to
    7  be rendered, notwithstanding that a different rate or charge has hereto-
    8  fore  been  prescribed  by  general or special statute, contract, grant,
    9  franchise, condition, consent or  other  agreement,  and  the  just  and
   10  reasonable  acts  and  regulations to be done and observed; and whenever
   11  the commission shall be of opinion, after a hearing  had  upon  its  own
   12  motion  or upon complaint, that the property, equipment or appliances of
   13  any such corporation are unsafe, inefficient or inadequate, the  commis-
   14  sion  shall  determine  and  prescribe  the safe, efficient and adequate
   15  property, equipment and appliances thereafter to be used, maintained and
   16  operated for the security and accommodation of the public and in compli-
   17  ance with the provisions of law and of their  franchises  and  charters;
   18  provided,  however,  that in its determination and prescription of safe,
   19  efficient and adequate property,  equipment  and  appliances  as  herein
   20  provided   any  such  property,  equipment  and  appliances  theretofore
   21  approved by the water power and control commission, or its  predecessor,
   22  shall be deemed to have been adequate, safe and efficient at the time of
   23  such approval. Nothing herein contained shall be deemed to dispense with
   24  any  approval of work by the water power and control commission required
   25  by the FORMER conservation law; and if such an approval pertains to work
   26  done pursuant to  such  determination  or  prescription  of  the  public
   27  service  commission, such approval shall be conclusive that the work was
   28  done in compliance with such determination or prescription.
   29    S 2. Section 89-i of the public service law, as amended by chapter 651
   30  of the laws of 1974, is amended to read as follows:
   31    S 89-i. Complaints as to price of water; investigation by  commission;
   32  forms  of  complaints.   Upon the complaint in writing of the mayor of a
   33  city, the trustees of a village or the town board of a town in  which  a
   34  person  or  corporation  is authorized to supply or distribute water for
   35  domestic, commercial, SEWERAGE or public uses, or upon the complaint  in
   36  writing  of  not  less  than twenty-five customers or purchasers of such
   37  water in such municipality or upon complaint  of  a  water-works  corpo-
   38  ration supplying such water, as to the rates, charges or classifications
   39  of  service  for  water sold and delivered in such municipality, or upon
   40  the complaint in writing of the state consumer protection board,  or  as
   41  to the methods employed in furnishing such service, the commission shall
   42  investigate  as  to  the cause of such complaint. When such complaint is
   43  made, the commission may,  by  its  agents,  examiners  and  inspectors,
   44  inspect  the  works, system, plant, devices, appliances and methods used
   45  by such water-works corporation, INCLUDING SUCH  CORPORATIONS  PROVIDING
   46  SEWERAGE  SERVICES,  in  supplying  and distributing such water, and may
   47  examine or cause to be examined the books and papers of such water-works
   48  corporation pertaining to the supplying and distributing of such  water.
   49  The  form  and  contents  of complaints made as provided in this section
   50  shall be prescribed by the commission. Such complaints shall  be  signed
   51  by  the  officers, or by the customers, purchasers or subscribers making
   52  them, who must add to their signatures their  places  of  residence,  by
   53  street and number, if any.
   54    S  3.  Section 89-l of the public service law, as added by chapter 715
   55  of the laws of 1931, is amended to read as follows:

       A. 2240                             3

    1    S 89-l. Municipal water systems. 1. For the purposes of this  section,
    2  and for the purposes of any jurisdiction conferred by it upon the public
    3  service commission, a municipality is one which owns, maintains or oper-
    4  ates,  or proposes to own, maintain or operate, a water system, or which
    5  sells,  furnishes  or  distributes,  or  proposes  to  sell,  furnish or
    6  distribute, water for domestic, commercial,  SEWERAGE  or  public  uses,
    7  whether provided by its own system or the system of a water-works corpo-
    8  ration  or  another municipality. As so limited, the term "municipality"
    9  for the purposes of this section, means a city, town, village or  public
   10  district;  and a "public district," as here used, is a district or other
   11  territorial division, whether incorporated or  not,  whose  affairs  are
   12  managed by any officer or officers, person or persons, elected by voters
   13  or taxpayers or appointed by a public officer or officers, and includes,
   14  without  excluding others, a water district, water supply district and a
   15  fire district. The other provisions of this chapter shall not  apply  to
   16  such  a municipality, nor to its said business of owning, maintaining or
   17  operating a water system  or  of  selling,  furnishing  or  distributing
   18  water,  except such provisions as are applied by this section by express
   19  reference. The jurisdiction  of  the  public  service  commission,  with
   20  respect  to  such a municipality or its said business, is that, and only
   21  that, provided for in this section.
   22    2. Each such municipality shall file with the public  service  commis-
   23  sion  a  copy of the annual report of its division, bureau or department
   24  of water.
   25    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
